snippet: The start-up had lost $500 million on Mr. Agassi’s watch, according to Automotive News.
abstract: The start-up had lost $500 million on Mr. Agassi’s watch, according to Automotive News.
lead_paragraph: Better Place, the electric-vehicle infrastructure start-up seeking to create networks of E.V.’s and battery-swapping stations around the world, has replaced Shai Agassi, its founding chief executive. Evan Thornley, the chief executive of the company’s operations in Australia, assumed global responsibilities on Tuesday, the company announced in a media release. Though Mr. Agassi would remain with the company as a board member, Automotive News reported he was dismissed as chief executive in part because he presided over $500 million in losses since the company’s founding.

headline.main: Better Place Replaces Shai Agassi, Its Founding C.E.O.
